info.title: AVOutput API
info.description: The AVOutput plugin lets you control the picture properties. It provides flexibility to modify picture properties per picture mode, source and format to the application. The `AVOutput` plugin replaces `ControlSettings` plugin.

getBacklight.summary: Gets the TV user backlight level for a given picture mode, source and format. Regardless of whether auto backlight control is set to ambient or manual getBacklight always return the manual user set backlight level. This method is only available in the RDK TV device profile.

pictureMode.summary:
The picture mode that the backlight level should be fetched for. e.g. "Current", "Standard", "Sports", "EnergySaving". "Current" - the current selected picture mode. Other valid values for a platform can be obtained from options field of [getPictureModeCaps](#method.getPictureModeCaps).

The caller can pass a single valid value for this parameter. If omitted the default value assumed is "Current".

videoSource.summary:
The video source that the backlight level should be fetched for. e.g. "Current", "Composite1", "HDMI1", "HDMI2", "HDMI3", "IP", "Tuner". "Current" - the current primary active source. When there is no active video playback or input port selected, "Current" refers to "IP" video source as default. Other valid values for a platform can be obtained from options field of [getVideoSourceCaps](#method.getVideoSourceCaps).

The caller can pass a single valid value for this parameter. If omitted the default value assumed is "Current".

videoFormat.summary:
The video format that the backlight level should be fetched for. e.g. "Current", "SDR", "HDR10", "HLG", "DV". "Current" - the current format of the current primary active source. When there is no active video playback or input port selected, "Current" refers to "SDR" video format as default. Other valid values for a platform can be obtained from options field of [getVideoFormatCaps](#method.getVideoFormatCaps).

The caller can pass a single valid value for this parameter. If omitted the default value assumed is "Current".

backlight.summary: The backlight level in the range from - to inclusive.

getBacklightCaps.summary: Gets the capability and boundary range for TV user backlight. It returns the range of TV user backlight values that the user can set and the list of possible picture modes, video sources and video formats that the TV user backlight may be customised for.

platformSupport.summary: true: The platform support backlight. false:  The platform does not support backlight.

rangeInfo.summary: Range of values for the TV user backlight.

from.summary: The lower-inclusive range value for result.backlight.

to.summary: The higher-inclusive range value for result.backlight.

pictureModeInfo.summary:
Array of picture modes that the backlight could be customised for. These are few examples of picture modes available in this array: "Standard", "Vivid", "Custom", "Movie", "Sports"]. This API will return the entire list of picture modes returned by [getPictureModeCaps](#method.getPictureModeCaps) or a subset of it.

If backlight cannot be customised for picture modes, then this property is not returned.

videoSourceInfo.summary: Array of video sources that the backlight could be customised for. These are few examples of video sources available in this array: ["Composite1", "HDMI1", "HDMI2", "HDMI3", "IP" ].This API will return the entire list of video sources returned by [getVideoSourceCaps](#method.getVideoSourceCaps), or a subset of it. If backlight cannot be customised for video sources, then this property is not returned.

videoFormatInfo.summary: Array of video formats that the backlight could be customised for. These are few examples of formats available in this array: ["SDR","HLG","HDR10","DV"]. This API will return the entire list of video formats returned by [getVideoFormatCaps](#method.getVideoFormatCaps), or a subset of it. If backlight cannot be customised for video format, then this property is not returned.

getColorTemperatureCaps.summary: Gets the capability and boundary range for TV color temperature. It returns the range of TV color temperature values that the user can set and the list of possible picture modes, video sources and video formats that the TV color temperature may be customised for.

options.summary: The array of available color temperature options. e.g., of the color temperatures available in the array: ["Standard", "Warm", "Cold", "UserDefined"].

pictureModeInfo.summary:
Array of picture modes that the hue could be customised for. These are few examples of picture modes available in this array: ["Standard", "Vivid", "Custom", "Movie", "Sports"]. getCMS.summary: Gets the TV CMS(Color Management System) color component level for a given picture mode, source and format for the specified color and component. This method is only available in the RDK TV device profile.

pictureMode.summary:
The picture mode that the CMS level should be fetched for. e.g. "Current", "Standard", "Sports", "EnergySaving". "Current" - the current selected picture mode. Other valid values for a platform can be obtained from options field of [getPictureModeCaps](#method.getPictureModeCaps).

The caller can pass a single valid value for this parameter. If omitted the default value assumed is "Current".

videoSource.summary:
The video source that the CMS level should be fetched for. e.g. "Current", "Composite1", "HDMI1", "HDMI2", "HDMI3", "IP", "Tuner". "Current" - the current primary active source. When there is no active video playback or input port selected, "Current" refers to "IP" video source as default. Other valid values for a platform can be obtained from options field of [getVideoSourceCaps](#method.getVideoSourceCaps).

The caller can pass a single valid value for this parameter. If omitted the default value assumed is "Current".

videoFormat.summary:
The video format that the CMS level should be fetched for. e.g. "Current", "SDR", "HDR10", "HLG", "DV". "Current" - the current format of the current primary active source. When there is no active video playback or input port selected, "Current" refers to "SDR" video format as default. Other valid values for a platform can be obtained from options field of [getVideoFormatCaps](#method.getVideoFormatCaps).

The caller can pass a single valid value for this parameter. If omitted the default value assumed is "Current".

color.summary:
The color that the CMS should be fetched for. e.g. "Red", "Green", "Blue", "Cyan", "Yellow", "Magenta". Valid values for a platform can be obtained from colorInfo field of [getCMSCaps](#method.getCMSCaps).

The caller must PASS a single valid value for this parameter.

component.summary:
The color that the CMS should be fetched for. e.g. "Saturation", "Hue", "Luma". Valid values for a platform can be obtained from componentInfo field of [getCMSCaps](#method.getCMSCaps).

The caller must PASS a single valid value for this parameter.

level.summary: The CMS level in the range from - to inclusive.

getCMSCaps.summary: Gets the capability and boundary range for TV CMS(Color Management System). It returns the range of TV CMS value that the user can set and the list of possible picture modes, video sources and video formats that the TV CMS may be customised for.

platformSupport.summary: true: The platform support CMS. false:  The platform does not support CMS.

componentSaturationRange.summary: Range of values for the componentSaturation.

from.summary: The lower-inclusive range value for componentSaturation

to.summary: The higher-inclusive range value for componentSaturation

from.summary: The lower-inclusive range value for componentHue

to.summary: The higher-inclusive range value for componentHue

from.summary: The lower-inclusive range value for componentLuma

to.summary: The higher-inclusive range value for componentLuma

pictureModeInfo.summary:
Array of picture modes that the CMS could be customised for. These are few examples of picture modes available in this array: "Standard", "Vivid", "Custom", "Movie", "Sports"]. This API will return the entire list of picture modes returned by [getPictureModeCaps](#method.getPictureModeCaps) or a subset of it.

If CMS cannot be customised for picture modes, then this property is not returned.

videoSourceInfo.summary: Array of video sources that the CMS could be customised for. These are few examples of video sources available in this array: ["Composite1", "HDMI1", "HDMI2", "HDMI3", "IP" ].This API will return the entire list of video sources returned by [getVideoSourceCaps](#method.getVideoSourceCaps), or a subset of it. If CMS cannot be customised for video sources, then this property is not returned.

videoFormatInfo.summary: Array of video formats that the CMS could be customised for. These are few examples of formats available in this array: ["SDR","HLG","HDR10","DV"]. This API will return the entire list of video formats returned by [getVideoFormatCaps](#method.getVideoFormatCaps), or a subset of it. If CMS cannot be customised for video format, then this property is not returned.

colorInfo.summary: Array of color values that the CMS could be customized for. These are few examples of formats available in this array: ["Red","Green","Blue","Cyan","Magenta","Yellow"].

componentInfo.summary: Array of component values that the CMS could be customized for. These are few examples of formats available in this array: ["Saturation","Hue","Luma"].

getLowLatencyState.summary: Gets the TV low latency State for a given picture mode, source and format. This method is only available in the RDK TV device profile.

pictureMode.summary:
The picture mode that the lowLatencyState level should be fetched for. e.g. "Current", "Standard", "Sports", "EnergySaving". "Current" - the current selected picture mode. Other valid values for a platform can be obtained from options field of [getPictureModeCaps](#method.getPictureModeCaps).

The caller can pass a single valid value for this parameter. If omitted the default value assumed is "Current".

videoSource.summary:
The video source that the lowLatencyState level should be fetched for. e.g. "Current", "Composite1", "HDMI1", "HDMI2", "HDMI3", "IP", "Tuner". "Current" - the current primary active source. When there is no active video playback or input port selected, "Current" refers to "IP" video source as default. Other valid values for a platform can be obtained from options field of [getVideoSourceCaps](#method.getVideoSourceCaps).

The caller can pass a single valid value for this parameter. If omitted the default value assumed is "Current".

videoFormat.summary:
The video format that the lowLatencyState level should be fetched for. e.g. "Current", "SDR", "HDR10", "HLG", "DV". "Current" - the current format of the current primary active source. When there is no active video playback or input port selected, "Current" refers to "SDR" video format as default. Other valid values for a platform can be obtained from options field of [getVideoFormatCaps](#method.getVideoFormatCaps).

The caller can pass a single valid value for this parameter. If omitted the default value assumed is "Current".

backlight.summary: True if device is in lowLatencyState.

getLowLatencyStateCaps.summary: Gets the capability and boundary range for low latency state. It returns the range of low latency state that the user can set and the list of possible picture modes, video sources and video formats that the low latency state may be customised for.

platformSupport.summary: true: The platform support lowLatencyState. false:  The platform does not support lowLatencyState.

pictureModeInfo.summary:
Array of picture modes that the lowLatencyState could be customised for. These are few examples of picture modes available in this array: "Standard", "Vivid", "Custom", "Movie", "Sports"]. This API will return the entire list of picture modes returned by [getPictureModeCaps](#method.getPictureModeCaps) or a subset of it.

If lowLatencyState cannot be customised for picture modes, then this property is not returned.

videoSourceInfo.summary: Array of video sources that the lowLatencyState could be customised for. These are few examples of video sources available in this array: ["Composite1", "HDMI1", "HDMI2", "HDMI3", "IP" ].This API will return the entire list of video sources returned by [getVideoSourceCaps](#method.getVideoSourceCaps), or a subset of it. If lowLatencyState cannot be customised for video sources, then this property is not returned.

videoFormatInfo.summary: Array of video formats that the lowLatencyState could be customised for. These are few examples of formats available in this array: ["SDR","HLG","HDR10","DV"]. This API will return the entire list of video formats returned by [getVideoFormatCaps](#method.getVideoFormatCaps), or a subset of it. If lowLatencyState cannot be customised for video format, then this property is not returned.

getZoomMode.summary: Gets the current TV zoom mode. This method is only available in the RDK TV device profile.

pictureMode.summary:
The picture mode that the zoom should be fetched for. e.g. "Current", "Standard", "Sports", "EnergySaving". "Current" - the current selected picture mode. Other valid values for a platform can be obtained from options field of [getPictureModeCaps](#method.getPictureModeCaps).

The caller can pass a single valid value for this parameter. If omitted the default value assumed is "Current".

videoSource.summary:
The video source that the zoom should be fetched for. e.g. "Current", "Composite1", "HDMI1", "HDMI2", "HDMI3", "IP", "Tuner". "Current" - the current primary active source. When there is no active video playback or input port selected, "Current" refers to "IP" video source as default. Other valid values for a platform can be obtained from options field of [getVideoSourceCaps](#method.getVideoSourceCaps).

The caller can pass a single valid value for this parameter. If omitted the default value assumed is "Current".

videoFormat.summary:
The video format that the zoom should be fetched for. e.g. "Current", "SDR", "HDR10", "HLG", "DV". "Current" - the current format of the current primary active source. When there is no active video playback or input port selected, "Current" refers to "SDR" video format as default. Other valid values for a platform can be obtained from options field of [getVideoFormatCaps](#method.getVideoFormatCaps).

The caller can pass a single valid value for this parameter. If omitted the default value assumed is "Current".

getZoomModeCaps.summary: Gets the capability for TV zoom mode. This method is only available in the RDK TV device profile.

options.summary:
Array of available zoom modes. These are few examples of options available in this array: ["TV AUTO","TV DIRECT","TV NORMAL","TV 16X9 STRETCH","TV 4X3 PILLARBOX","TV ZOOM"]

TV AUTO - Auto mode shall fill the 16:9 panel display, without cropping any video and leaving black bars, while maintaining the pixel aspect ratio.
TV DIRECT - Show actual image as it is without cropping
TV NORMAL - Same as Auto
TV 16X9 STRETCH - 16:9 mode shall always resize the video to fill the 16:9 panel display.
TV 4X3 PILLARBOX - 4:3 mode shall always resize the video to fill the centre 4:3 area of the 16:9 panel display.
TV ZOOM - Zoom mode shall zoom fill the 16:9 panel display, leaving no black bars and cropping the video, while maintaining the pixel aspect ratio.

The list options will change per platform

pictureModeInfo.summary:
Array of picture modes that the zoom mode could be customised for. These are few examples of picture modes available in this array: "Standard", "Vivid", "Custom", "Movie", "Sports"]. This API will return the entire list of picture modes returned by [getPictureModeCaps](#method.getPictureModeCaps) or a subset of it.

If zoom mode cannot be customised for picture modes, then this property is not returned.

videoSourceInfo.summary: Array of video sources that the zoom mode could be customised for. These are few examples of video sources available in this array: ["Composite1", "HDMI1", "HDMI2", "HDMI3", "IP" ].This API will return the entire list of video sources returned by [getVideoSourceCaps](#method.getVideoSourceCaps), or a subset of it. If zoom mode cannot be customised for video sources, then this property is not returned.

videoFormatInfo.summary: Array of video formats that the zoom mode could be customised for. These are few examples of formats available in this array: ["SDR","HLG","HDR10","DV"]. This API will return the entire list of video formats returned by [getVideoFormatCaps](#method.getVideoFormatCaps), or a subset of it. If zoom mode cannot be customised for video format, then this property is not returned.

getBacklightDimmingMode.summary: Gets the TV backlight dimming mode for a given picture mode, source and format. This method is only available in the RDK TV device profile.

pictureMode.summary:
The picture mode that the backlight dimming mode should be fetched for. e.g. "Current", "Standard", "Sports", "EnergySaving". "Current" - the current selected picture mode. Other valid values for a platform can be obtained from options field of [getPictureModeCaps](#method.getPictureModeCaps).

The caller can pass a single valid value for this parameter. If omitted the default value assumed is "Current".

videoSource.summary:
The video source that the backlight dimming mode should be fetched for. e.g. "Current", "Composite1", "HDMI1", "HDMI2", "HDMI3", "IP", "Tuner". "Current" - the current primary active source. When there is no active video playback or input port selected, "Current" refers to "IP" video source as default. Other valid values for a platform can be obtained from options field of [getVideoSourceCaps](#method.getVideoSourceCaps).

The caller can pass a single valid value for this parameter. If omitted the default value assumed is "Current".

videoFormat.summary:
The video format that the backlight dimming mode should be fetched for. e.g. "Current", "SDR", "HDR10", "HLG", "DV". "Current" - the current format of the current primary active source. When there is no active video playback or input port selected, "Current" refers to "SDR" video format as default. Other valid values for a platform can be obtained from options field of [getVideoFormatCaps](#method.getVideoFormatCaps).

The caller can pass a single valid value for this parameter. If omitted the default value assumed is "Current".

dimmingMode.summary: The selected dimming mode for the picture mode, video source and video format mentioned in the request

getBacklightDimmingModeCaps.summary: Gets the capabilities and boundary range for TV backlight dimming mode. It returns the range of TV dimming mode values that the user can set and the list of possible picture modes, video sources and video formats that the TV backlight dimming mode may be customized for. This method is only available in the RDK TV device profile

platformSupport.summary: true: The platform support backlight dimming mode. false:  The platform does not support backlight dimming mode.

options.summary:
The array of available dimming mode options. e.g., of the color temperatures available in the array: ["Fixed" , "Local" , "Global" ]

Local :The backlight level can be controlled on individual zones based on the histogram.
Fixed: The backlight level is fixed. User backlight will be applied. No dimming.
Global: The backlight level is controlled globally based on the current frame histogram.

pictureModeInfo.summary:
Array of picture modes that the dimming mode could be customised for. These are few examples of picture modes available in this array: "Standard", "Vivid", "Custom", "Movie", "Sports"]. This API will return the entire list of picture modes returned by [getPictureModeCaps](#method.getPictureModeCaps) or a subset of it.
If dimming mode cannot be customised for picture modes, then this property is not returned.

videoSourceInfo.summary:
Array of video sources that the dimming mode could be customised for. These are few examples of video sources available in this array: ["Composite1", "HDMI1", "HDMI2", "HDMI3", "IP" ].This API will return the entire list of video sources returned by [getVideoSourceCaps](#method.getVideoSourceCaps), or a subset of it.
If dimming mode cannot be customised for video sources, then this property is not returned.

videoFormatInfo.summary:
Array of video formats that the dimming mode could be customised for. These are few examples of formats available in this array: ["SDR","HLG","HDR10","DV"]. This API will return the entire list of video formats returned by [getVideoFormatCaps](#method.getVideoFormatCaps), or a subset of it.
If dimming mode cannot be customised for video format, then this property is not returned.

pictureMode.summary:
The picture mode that the DolbyVision mode should be fetched for. e.g. "Current", "Standard", "Sports", "EnergySaving". "Current" - the current selected picture mode. Other valid values for a platform can be obtained from options field of [getPictureModeCaps](#method.getPictureModeCaps).

The caller can pass a single valid value for this parameter. If omitted the default value assumed is "Current".

videoSource.summary:
The video source that the DolbyVision mode should be fetched for. e.g. "Current", "Composite1", "HDMI1", "HDMI2", "HDMI3", "IP", "Tuner". "Current" - the current primary active source. When there is no active video playback or input port selected, "Current" refers to "IP" video source as default. Other valid values for a platform can be obtained from options field of [getVideoSourceCaps](#method.getVideoSourceCaps).

The caller can pass a single valid value for this parameter. If omitted the default value assumed is "Current".

getDolbyVisionModeCaps.summary: Gets the capability for DolbyVision mode. It returns the options of DolbyVision mode values that the user can set and the list of possible picture modes and video sources that the DolbyVision mode may be customised for.

platformSupport.summary: true: The platform support DolbyVision mode. false:  The platform does not support DolbyVision mode.

options.summary: Array of available options of DolbyVision modes. e.g. "Dark", "Bright"

pictureModeInfo.summary:
Array of picture modes that the DolbyVision mode could be customised for. These are few examples of picture modes available in this array: "Standard", "Vivid", "Custom", "Movie", "Sports"]. This API will return the entire list of picture modes returned by [getPictureModeCaps](#method.getPictureModeCaps) or a subset of it.

If DolbyVision mode cannot be customised for picture modes, then this property is not returned.

videoSourceInfo.summary: Array of video sources that the DolbyVision mode could be customised for. These are few examples of video sources available in this array: ["Composite1", "HDMI1", "HDMI2", "HDMI3", "IP" ].This API will return the entire list of video sources returned by [getVideoSourceCaps](#method.getVideoSourceCaps), or a subset of it. If DolbyVision mode cannot be customised for video sources, then this property is not returned.

getHDRMode.summary: Gets the HDR10 mode for a given picture mode, video format and video source. This method is only available in the RDK TV device profile.

pictureMode.summary:
The picture mode that the HDR mode should be fetched for. e.g. "Current", "Standard", "Sports", "EnergySaving". "Current" - the current selected picture mode. Other valid values for a platform can be obtained from options field of [getPictureModeCaps](#method.getPictureModeCaps).

The caller can pass a single valid value for this parameter. If omitted the default value assumed is "Current".

videoSource.summary:
The video source that the HDR mode should be fetched for. e.g. "Current", "HDMI1", "HDMI2", "HDMI3", "IP". "Current" - the current primary active source. When there is no active video playback or input port selected, "Current" refers to "IP" video source as default. Other valid values for a platform can be obtained from options field of [getVideoSourceCaps](#method.getVideoSourceCaps).

The caller can pass a single valid value for this parameter. If omitted the default value assumed is "Current".

videoFormat.summary:
The video format that the HDR mode should be fetched for. e.g. "Current", "HDR10", "HLG", "DV". "Current" - the current format of the current primary active source. When there is no active video playback or input port selected, "Current" refers to "SDR" video format as default. Other valid values for a platform can be obtained from options field of [getVideoFormatCaps](#method.getVideoFormatCaps).

The caller can pass a single valid value for this parameter. If omitted the default value assumed is "Current".

getHDRModeCaps.summary: Gets the capability for HDR mode. It returns the options of HDR mode values that the user can set and the list of possible picture modes, video sources and video formats that the HDR mode may be customized for.

platformSupport.summary: true: The platform support HDR modes. false:  The platform does not support HDR modes.

pictureModeInfo.summary:
Array of picture modes that the HDR mode could be customised for. These are few examples of picture modes available in this array: "Standard", "Vivid", "Custom", "Movie", "Sports"]. This API will return the entire list of picture modes returned by [getPictureModeCaps](#method.getPictureModeCaps) or a subset of it.

videoSourceInfo.summary: Array of video sources that the HDR mode could be customised for. These are few examples of video sources available in this array: ["Composite1", "HDMI1", "HDMI2", "HDMI3", "IP" ].This API will return the entire list of video sources returned by [getVideoSourceCaps](#method.getVideoSourceCaps), or a subset of it. If HDR mode cannot be customised for video sources, then this property is not returned.

videoFormatInfo.summary: Array of video formats that the HDR mode could be customised for. These are few examples of formats available in this array: ["HLG","HDR10","DV"]. This API will return the entire list of video formats returned by [getVideoFormatCaps](#method.getVideoFormatCaps), or a subset of it. If HDR mode cannot be customised for video format, then this property is not returned.

getVideoFormatCaps.summary: Get all supported video formats for the platform.

options.summary:
Array of video formats that the system can support. These are few examples of video formats available in this array:

e.g,["HDR10", "HLG", "SDR", "DV"].

getVideoSourceCaps.summary: Get all supported video sources for the platform.

options.summary:
Array of video sources that the system can support. These are few examples of video sources available in this array:

e.g, ["HDMI1", "HDMI2", "HDMI3", "IP", "Tuner", "Composite1"].

getVideoFrameRateCaps.summary: Get all supported video frame rates for the platform.

options.summary: Array of video frame rates that the system can support. These are few examples of video frame rates available in this array: [24,30,50,60].

getVideoResolutionCaps.summary: Get all supported video resolutions for the platform.

maxResolution.summary:
The maximum resolution supported by the system.
e.g, "4096*2160p"

getPictureMode.summary: Get picture mode for a given video source and video format.

videoSource.summary:
The video source for which the picture mode is requested for. e.g. "Current", "HDMI1", "Composite1", "IP". "Current" refers to the current selected video source. When there is no active video playback or input port selected, "Current" refers to "IP" video source as default. Other valid values for a platform can be obtained from options field of [getVideoSourceCaps](#method.getVideoSourceCaps).

The caller can pass a single valid value for this parameter. If omitted the default value assumed is "Current".

videoFormat.summary:
The video format for which the picture mode is requested for. e.g. "Current", "HDR10", "SDR", "DV". "Current" refers to the current video format of the video played. When there is no active video playback or input port selected, "Current" refers to "SDR" video format as default. Other valid values for a platform can be obtained from options field of [getVideoFormatCaps](#method.getVideoFormatCaps).

The caller can pass a single valid value for this parameter. If omitted the default value assumed is "Current".

pictureMode.summary: The picture mode string requested.

getPictureModeCaps.summary: Get the list of picture modes supported and the list of video sources and video formats against which a picture mode can be associated with.

videoSourceInfo.summary:
Array of video sources to which the picture mode can be associated with.
e.g. ["Composite1", "HDMI1", "HDMI2", "HDMI3", "IP" ].

This API will return the entire list of video sources returned by [getVideoSourceCaps](#method.getVideoSourceCaps), or a subset of it. If the picture mode cannot be associated with any video source, then this property is not returned.

videoFormatInfo.summary:
Array of video formats to which the picture mode can be associated with.
e.g.["SDR", "HDR10","HLG","DV"].

This API will return the entire list of video formats returned by [getVideoFormatCaps](#method.getVideoFormatCaps), or a subset of it. If the picture mode cannot be associated with any video format, then this property is not returned.

getVideoFormat.summary: Returns the video format of the currently played video content.

currentVideoFormat.summary:
The current video format of the video played.
e.g. ["SDR", "HLG","HDR10","DV","None"].

None - Returned when no video is played.
For the complete list of possible video formats refer [getVideoFormatCaps](#method.getVideoFormatCaps).

currentVideoSource.summary:
The current video source selected.
e.g."HDMI1", "HDMI2", "HDMI3", "IP", "Tuner", "Composite1","None".

None - Returned when no video is played.
For the complete list of possible video sources refer [getVideoSourceCaps](#method.getVideoSourceCaps).

getVideoFrameRate.summary: Returns the video frame rate of the video being played.

currentVideoFrameRate.summary:
The current video source selected.
e.g., 0,24,30,50,60.

0 - Returned when no video is played.
For the complete list of possible video frame rates refer [getVideoFrameRateCaps](#method.getVideoFrameRateCaps).

getVideoContentType.summary: Returns the FilmMaker mode status if it is enabled or disabled and in which sources the FilmMaker mode is active. This method is only available in the RDK TV device profile.

currentFilmMakerMode.summary:
Possible values are true and false.
true - Film Maker mode active
false -Film Maker mode not active

currentFilmMakerModeSources.summary:
A list of sources in which the Film Maker mode event occurred.
If there "params.currentFilmMakerMode" is false this parameter is not passed.
Possible video sources for film maker mode are HDMI sources (as returned by [getVideoSourceCaps](#method.getVideoSourceCaps)) and IP source

getVideoResolution.summary: Returns the video resolution of the video being played.

currentVideoResolution.summary:
The current video resolution of the video being played.
e.g.,"None","720\*240p","720\*288p","720\*480i","720\*480p".
None - Returned when no video is played.
For the complete list of possible video resolution refer [getVideoResolutionCaps](#method.getVideoResolutionCaps).

getAutoBackLightMode.summary: Gets the TV auto backlight mode for a given picture mode, source and format. Auto backlight can also refer to Dolby Light Sense in products that are licensed with Dolby Advanced Imaging.This method is only available in the RDK TV device profile.

pictureMode.summary:
The picture mode that the auto backlight mode should be fetched for. e.g. "Current", "Standard", "Sports", "EnergySaving". "Current" - the current selected picture mode. Other valid values for a platform can be obtained from options field of [getPictureModeCaps](#method.getPictureModeCaps).

The caller can pass a single valid value for this parameter. If omitted the default value assumed is "Current".

videoSource.summary:
The video source that the auto backlight mode should be fetched for. e.g. "Current", "Composite1", "HDMI1", "HDMI2", "HDMI3", "IP", "Tuner". "Current" - the current primary active source. When there is no active video playback or input port selected, "Current" refers to "IP" video source as default. Other valid values for a platform can be obtained from options field of [getVideoSourceCaps](#method.getVideoSourceCaps).

The caller can pass a single valid value for this parameter. If omitted the default value assumed is "Current".

videoFormat.summary:
The picture format that the auto backlight mode should be fetched for. e.g. "Current", "SDR", "HDR10", "HLG", "DV". "Current" - the current format of the current primary active source. When there is no active video playback or input port selected, "Current" refers to "SDR" video format as default. Other valid values for a platform can be obtained from options field of [getVideoFormatCaps](#method.getVideoFormatCaps).

The caller can pass a single valid value for this parameter. If omitted the default value assumed is "Current".

mode.summary: The auto backlight mode in the options of [getAutoBacklightModeCaps](#method.getAutoBacklightModeCaps)

getAutoBacklightModeCaps.summary:
Gets the capabilities and boundary range for TV auto backlight mode. It returns the range of auto backlight mode values that the user can set and the list of possible picture modes, video sources and video formats that the TV auto backlight mode may be customized for.

Auto backlight can also refer to Dolby Light Sense in products that are licensed with Dolby Advanced Imaging.

platformSupport.summary: true: The platform support backlight auto backlight mode. false:  The platform does not support backlight auto backlight mode.

options.summary:
The array of available auto backlight mode options. e.g., of the modes available in the array: ["Manual", "Ambient"]

Ambient : The backlight level is controlled globally based on the room ambience level.
Manual : The backlight level is fixed. User backlight will be applied.

pictureModeInfo.summary:
Array of picture modes that the auto backlight mode could be customised for. These are few examples of picture modes available in this array: "Standard", "Vivid", "Custom", "Movie", "Sports"]. This API will return the entire list of picture modes returned by [getPictureModeCaps](#method.getPictureModeCaps) or a subset of it.

If auto backlight mode cannot be customised for picture modes, then this property is not returned.

videoSourceInfo.summary:
Array of video sources that the auto backlight mode could be customised for. These are few examples of video sources available in this array: ["Composite1", "HDMI1", "HDMI2", "HDMI3", "IP" ].This API will return the entire list of video sources returned by [getVideoSourceCaps](#method.getVideoSourceCaps), or a subset of it.

If auto backlight mode cannot be customised for video sources, then this property is not returned.

videoFormatInfo.summary:
Array of video formats that the auto backlight mode could be customised for. These are few examples of formats available in this array: ["SDR","HLG","HDR10","DV"]. This API will return the entire list of video formats returned by [getVideoFormatCaps](#method.getVideoFormatCaps), or a subset of it.

If auto backlight mode cannot be customised for video format, then this property is not returned.

getFadeDisplayCaps.summary: Gets the capabilities and boundary range for fading the display.

platformSupport.summary:
true: The platform supports display fading.
false: The platform does not support display fading.

from.summary: The percentage of current backlight value from where fade starts.

to.summary: The Percentage of current backlight value from where fade ends.

durationInfo.summary: Range of values for the fadeDisplay duration value

from.summary: The lower-inclusive range value for durationInfo.

to.summary: The higher-inclusive range value for durationInfo.

setPictureMode.summary:
Set picture mode for a given video source and video format.
This method is only available in the RDK TV device profile.

pictureMode.summary:
The picture mode to be associated with the specified video source and video format.

e.g. "sports", "Theatre", "game"

Other valid values for a platform can be obtained from "pictureModeInfo" field returned by [getPictureModeCaps](#method.getPictureModeCaps)

videoSource.summary:
The video source(s) to which the picture mode needs to be associated with.
e.g. [ "Global" ] OR [ "Current", "HDMI1", "Composite1", "IP"]

The caller can either pass "Current" or "Global" as single value in the array or can pass any number of customisable video sources. When omitted "Global" is the default assumed.

Other valid values for a platform can be obtained from "videoSourceInfo" field returned by [getPictureModeCaps](#method.getPictureModeCaps)

current refers to current video source selected. When there is no active video playback or input port selected, usage of "Current" will refer to "IP" video source as default. If current selected video source is not part of videoSourceInfo field returned by [getPictureModeCaps](#method.getPictureModeCaps), then it is not customizable and cannot be used.

"Global" specifies that picture mode is associated for all customisable video sources that are returned in videoSourceInfo field by [getPictureModeCaps](#method.getPictureModeCaps). When there is no videoSourceInfo field returned by [getPictureModeCaps](#method.getPictureModeCaps) then "Global" refers to all video sources returned by "videoSources" field of [getVideoSourceCaps](#method.getVideoSourceCaps).

videoFormat.summary:
The video format(s) to which the picture mode needs to be associated with.

e.g. [ "Global" ] OR ["Current", "HDR10", "SDR", "DV"]

The caller can either pass "Current" or "Global" as single value in the array or can pass any number of customisable video formats. When omitted "Global" is the default assumed.

Other valid values for a platform can be obtained from "videoFormatInfo" field returned by [getPictureModeCaps](#method.getPictureModeCaps)

current refers to current video format selected. When there is no active video playback or input port selected, usage of "Current" will refer to "SDR" video format as default. If current selected video source is not part of "videoFormatInfo" field returned by [getPictureModeCaps](#method.getPictureModeCaps), then it is not customizable and cannot be used.

"Global" specifies that picture mode is associated for all customisable video formats that are returned in "videoFormatInfo" field by getPictureModeCaps. When there is no "videoFormatInfo" field returned by [getPictureModeCaps](#method.getPictureModeCaps) then "Global" refers to all video formats returned by "videoFormats" field of [getVideoFormatCaps](#method.getVideoFormatCaps).

setBacklight.summary:
Sets the TV user backlight level for a given picture mode, video format and video source. The backlight value that is to be set should be within the range which is returned by the API [getBacklightCaps](#method.getBacklightCaps).

If the auto backlight control is set to ambient, the TV user backlight changes made by this API will not take effect until auto backlight control is switched to manual.

The set value will be persisted across reboots.

This method is only available in the RDK TV device profile

pictureMode.summary:
The picture mode that the backlight level is customised for.

e.g. [ "Global" ] OR ["Current", "Standard", "Sports", "EnergySaving" ]

The caller can either pass "Current" or "Global" as single value in the array or can pass any number of customisable picture modes. When omitted "Global" is the default assumed.

Other valid values for a platform can be obtained from the [getBacklightCaps](#method.getBacklightCaps) "pictureModeInfo" property

"Current" specifies the current selected picture mode which can be obtained from [getPictureMode](#method.getPictureMode). If current selected picture mode is not part of pictureModeInfo field returned by [getBacklightCaps](#method.getBacklightCaps), then it is not customizable and cannot be used.

"Global" specifies that backlight is changed for all customisable pictures modes that are returned in pictureModeInfo field by [getBacklightCaps](#method.getBacklightCaps). When there is no pictureModeInfo field returned by [getBacklightCaps](#method.getBacklightCaps) then "Global" refers to all picture modes returned by "pictureModes" field of [getPictureModeCaps](#method.getPictureModeCaps).

videoSource.summary:
The video source that the backlight level is customised for.
e.g. [ "Global" ] OR [ "Current", "HDMI1", "Composite1", "IP"]

The caller can either pass "Current" or "Global" as single value in the array or can pass any number of customisable video sources. When omitted "Global" is the default assumed.

Other valid values for a platform can be obtained from the [getBacklightCaps](#method.getBacklightCaps) "videoSourceInfo" property

"Current" specifies the current selected video source which can be obtained from [getVideoSource](#method.getVideoSource). When there is no active video playback or input port selected, usage of "Current" will refer to "IP" video source as default. If current selected video source is not part of videoSourceInfo field returned by [getBacklightCaps](#method.getBacklightCaps), then it is not customizable and cannot be used.

"Global" specifies that backlight is changed for all customisable video sources that are returned in videoSourceInfo field by [getBacklightCaps](#method.getBacklightCaps). When there is no videoSourceInfo field returned by [getBacklightCaps](#method.getBacklightCaps) then "Global" refers to all video sources returned by "videoSources" field of [getVideoSourceCaps](#method.getVideoSourceCaps).

videoFormat.summary:
The video format that the backlight level is customised for.

e.g. [ "Global" ] OR ["Current", "HDR10", "SDR", "DV"]

The caller can either pass "Current" or "Global" as single value in the array or can pass any number of customisable video formats. When omitted "Global" is the default assumed.

Other valid values for a platform can be obtained from the [getBacklightCaps](#method.getBacklightCaps) "videoFormatInfo" property

"Current" specifies the current selected video format which can be obtained from [getVideoFormat](#method.getVideoFormat). When there is no active video playback or input port selected, usage of "Current" will refer to "SDR" video format as default. If current selected video format is not part of videoSourceInfo field returned by [getBacklightCaps](#method.getBacklightCaps), then it is not customizable and cannot be used.

"Global" specifies that backlight is changed for all customisable video formats that are returned in videoFormatInfo field by [getBacklightCaps](#method.getBacklightCaps). When there is no videoFormatInfo field returned by [getBacklightCaps](#method.getBacklightCaps) then "Global" refers to all video formats returned by "videoFormats" field of [getVideoFormatCaps](#method.getVideoFormatCaps).

backlight.summary: The backlight value to be set. It should be within the range as retrieved from [getBacklightCaps](#method.getBacklightCaps)

setBrightness.summary:
Sets the TV brightness level for a given picture mode, video format and video source. The brightness value that is to be set should be within the range which is returned by the API [getBrightnessCaps](#method.getBrightnessCaps).

The set value will be persisted across reboots.

This method is only available in the RDK TV device profile

pictureMode.summary:
The picture mode that the brightness level is customised for.

e.g. [ "Global" ] OR ["Current", "Standard", "Sports", "EnergySaving" ]

The caller can either pass "Current" or "Global" as single value in the array or can pass any number of customisable picture modes. When omitted "Global" is the default assumed.

Other valid values for a platform can be obtained from the [getBrightnessCaps](#method.getBrightnessCaps) "pictureModeInfo" property

"Current" specifies the current selected picture mode which can be obtained from [getPictureMode](#method.getPictureMode). If current selected picture mode is not part of pictureModeInfo field returned by [getBrightnessCaps](#method.getBrightnessCaps), then it is not customizable and cannot be used.

"Global" specifies that brightness is changed for all customisable pictures modes that are returned in pictureModeInfo field by [getBrightnessCaps](#method.getBrightnessCaps). When there is no pictureModeInfo field returned by [getBrightnessCaps](#method.getBrightnessCaps) then "Global" refers to all picture modes returned by "pictureModes" field of [getPictureModeCaps](#method.getPictureModeCaps).

videoSource.summary:
The video source that the brightness level is customised for.

e.g. [ "Global" ] OR [ "Current", "HDMI1", "Composite1", "IP"]

The caller can either pass "Current" or "Global" as single value in the array or can pass any number of customisable video sources. When omitted "Global" is the default assumed.

Other valid values for a platform can be obtained from the [getBrightnessCaps](#method.getBrightnessCaps) "videoSourceInfo" property

"Current" specifies the current selected video source which can be obtained from [getVideoSource](#method.getVideoSource). When there is no active video playback or input port selected, usage of "Current" will refer to "IP" video source as default. If current selected video source is not part of videoSourceInfo field returned by [getBrightnessCaps](#method.getBrightnessCaps), then it is not customizable and cannot be used.

"Global" specifies that brightness is changed for all customisable video sources that are returned in videoSourceInfo field by [getBrightnessCaps](#method.getBrightnessCaps). When there is no videoSourceInfo field returned by [getBrightnessCaps](#method.getBrightnessCaps) then "Global" refers to all video sources returned by "videoSources" field of [getVideoSourceCaps](#method.getVideoSourceCaps).

Other valid values for a platform can be obtained from the [getLowLatencyStateCaps](#method.getLowLatencyStateCaps) "videoSourceInfo" property

"Current" specifies the current selected video source which can be obtained from [getVideoSource](#method.getVideoSource). When there is no active video playback or input port selected, usage of "Current" will refer to "IP" video source as default. If current selected video source is not part of videoSourceInfo field returned by [getLowLatencyStateCaps](#method.getLowLatencyStateCaps), then it is not customizable and cannot be used.

"Global" specifies that lowLatencyState is changed for all customisable video sources that are returned in videoSourceInfo field by [getLowLatencyStateCaps](#method.getLowLatencyStateCaps). When there is no videoSourceInfo field returned by [getLowLatencyStateCaps](#method.getLowLatencyStateCaps) then "Global" refers to all video sources returned by "videoSources" field of [getVideoSourceCaps](#method.getVideoSourceCaps).

videoFormat.summary:

e.g. [ "Global" ] OR ["Current", "HDR10", "SDR", "DV"]

Other valid values for a platform can be obtained from the [getLowLatencyStateCaps](#method.getLowLatencyStateCaps) "videoFormatInfo" property

If current selected video format is not part of videoSourceInfo field returned by [getLowLatencyStateCaps](#method.getLowLatencyStateCaps), then it is not customizable and cannot be used.

"Global" specifies that lowLatencyState is changed for all customisable video formats that are returned in videoFormatInfo field by [getLowLatencyStateCaps](#method.getLowLatencyStateCaps). When there is no videoFormatInfo field returned by [getLowLatencyStateCaps](#method.getLowLatencyStateCaps) then "Global" refers to all video formats returned by "videoFormats" field of [getVideoFormatCaps](#method.getVideoFormatCaps).

LowLatencyState.summary: 1 or 0 representing the lowLatencyState value to be set.

"Current" specifies the current selected video format which can be obtained from [getVideoFormat](#method.getVideoFormat). When there is no active video playback or input port selected, usage of "Current" will refer to "SDR" video format as default. If current selected video format is not part of videoSourceInfo field returned by [getBacklightDimmingModeCaps](#method.getBacklightDimmingModeCaps), then it is not customizable and cannot be used.

"Global" specifies that backlight dimming mode is changed for all customisable video formats that are returned in videoFormatInfo field by [getBacklightDimmingModeCaps](#method.getBacklightDimmingModeCaps). When there is no videoFormatInfo field returned by [getBacklightDimmingModeCaps](#method.getBacklightDimmingModeCaps) then "Global" refers to all video formats returned by "videoFormats" field of [getVideoFormatCaps](#method.getVideoFormatCaps).

dimmingMode.summary: The dimming mode value to be set. It should be one of the options retrieved from [getBacklightDimmingModeCaps](#method.getBacklightDimmingModeCaps)

fadeDisplay.summary:
Fades the backlight between two different backlight percentage values specified in a given duration in ms. The current backlight will be mapped to the "from" percentage and backlight will be faded to the target value (to percentage) on a specified duration in ms.

The function call is asynchronous and expected to return immediately after initiating the fading process. If there is change in backlight during middle of fade due to [setBacklight](#method.setBacklight) API call or a change initiated due to picture mode change or primary video source change or primary video format change, then fade params will be recalculated according to new backlight values.

This method is only available in the RDK TV device profile.

Fade values are not persisted.

from.summary:
The percentage of current backlight value from where fade starts.

When omitted 100% is the default assumed.

to.summary:
The percentage of current backlight value from where fade ends.

When omitted 0% is the default assumed.

durationMs.summary:
The duration of Fade in milliseconds. Time duration for which the backlight needs to be faded to reach new value. The durationMs range supported by a platform can be obtained from the [getFadeDisplayCaps](#method.getFadeDisplayCaps) "durationInfo" property

When omitted 0 is the default assumed.

setDolbyVisionMode.summary:

When there is no videoSourceInfo field returned by [getAutoBacklightModeCaps](#method.getAutoBacklightModeCaps) then "Global" refers to all video sources returned by "videoSources" field of [getVideoSourceCaps](#method.getVideoSourceCaps).

The video format that the auto backlight mode is customised for.

e.g. [ "Global" ] OR ["Current", "HDR10", "SDR", "DV"]

The caller can either pass "Current" or "Global" as single value in the array or can pass any number of customisable video formats. When omitted "Global" is the default assumed.

Other valid values for a platform can be obtained from the [getAutoBacklightModeCaps](#method.getAutoBacklightModeCaps) "videoFormatInfo" property

If current selected video format is not part of videoSourceInfo field returned by [getAutoBacklightModeCaps](#method.getAutoBacklightModeCaps), then it is not customizable and cannot be used.

resetPictureMode.summary: Reset picture mode to default for a given video source and video format. The reset value will be persisted across reboots.

videoSource.summary:
The video source(s) to which the picture mode needs to be associated with.
e.g. [ "Global" ] OR [ "Current", "HDMI1", "Composite1", "IP"]

The caller can either pass "Current" or "Global" as single value in the array or can pass any number of customisable video sources. When omitted "Global" is the default assumed.

Other valid values for a platform can be obtained from "videoSourceInfo" field returned by [getPictureModeCaps](#method.getPictureModeCaps)

current refers to current video source selected. When there is no active video playback or input port selected, usage of "Current" will refer to "IP" video source as default. If current selected video source is not part of videoSourceInfo field returned by [getPictureModeCaps](#method.getPictureModeCaps), then it is not customizable and cannot be used.

"Global" specifies that picture mode is associated for all customisable video sources that are returned in videoSourceInfo field by [getPictureModeCaps](#method.getPictureModeCaps). When there is no videoSourceInfo field returned by [getPictureModeCaps](#method.getPictureModeCaps) then "Global" refers to all video sources returned by "videoSources" field of [getVideoSourceCaps](#method.getVideoSourceCaps).

The video format(s) to which the picture mode needs to be associated with.

e.g. [ "Global" ] OR ["Current", "HDR10", "SDR", "DV"]

The caller can either pass "Current" or "Global" as single value in the array or can pass any number of customisable video formats. When omitted "Global" is the default assumed.

Other valid values for a platform can be obtained from "videoFormatInfo" field returned by [getPictureModeCaps](#method.getPictureModeCaps)

current refers to current video format selected. When there is no active video playback or input port selected, usage of "Current" will refer to "SDR" video format as default. If current selected video source is not part of "videoFormatInfo" field returned by [getPictureModeCaps](#method.getPictureModeCaps), then it is not customizable and cannot be used.

"Global" specifies that picture mode is associated for all customisable video formats that are returned in "videoFormatInfo" field by [getPictureModeCaps](#method.getPictureModeCaps). When there is no "videoFormatInfo" field returned by [getPictureModeCaps](#method.getPictureModeCaps) then "Global" refers to all video formats returned by "videoFormats" field of [getVideoFormatCaps](#method.getVideoFormatCaps).

resetBacklight.summary:
Resets the TV user Backlight to factory default for a given picture mode, video format and video source.

If the auto backlight control is set to ambient, the TV user backlight change to default value made by this API will not take effect until auto backlight control is switched to manual.

The reset value will be persisted across reboots.

This method is only available in the RDK TV device profile.

pictureMode.summary:
The picture mode that the backlight level is reset for.

e.g. [ "Global" ] OR ["Current", "Standard", "Sports", "EnergySaving" ]

The caller can either pass "Current" or "Global" as single value in the array or can pass any number of customisable picture modes that the backlight need to reset to default. When omitted "Global" is the default assumed.

Other valid values for a platform can be obtained from the [getBacklightCaps](#method.getBacklightCaps) "pictureModeInfo" property

"Current" specifies the current selected picture mode which can be obtained from [getPictureMode](#method.getPictureMode). If current selected picture mode is not part of pictureModeInfo field returned by [getBacklightCaps](#method.getBacklightCaps), then it is not customizable and cannot be used.

"Global" specifies that backlight is reset for all customisable pictures modes that are returned in pictureModeInfo field by [getBacklightCaps](#method.getBacklightCaps). When there is no pictureModeInfo field returned by [getBacklightCaps](#method.getBacklightCaps) then "Global" refers to all picture modes returned by "pictureModes" field of [getPictureModeCaps](#method.getPictureModeCaps).

videoSource.summary:
The video source that the backlight level is reset for.

e.g. [ "Global" ] OR [ "Current", "HDMI1", "Composite1", "IP"]

The caller can either pass "Current" or "Global" as single value in the array or can pass any number of customisable video sources that the backlight need to reset to default. When omitted "Global" is the default assumed.

Other valid values for a platform can be obtained from the [getBacklightCaps](#method.getBacklightCaps) "videoSourceInfo" property

"Current" specifies the current selected video source which can be obtained from [getVideoSource](#method.getVideoSource). When there is no active video playback or input port selected, usage of "Current" will refer to "IP" video source as default. If "Current" video source is not part of "videoSourceInfo" field returned by [getBacklightCaps](#method.getBacklightCaps), then it is not customizable and cannot be used.

"Global" specifies that backlight is reset for all customisable video sources that are returned in "videoSourceInfo" field by [getBacklightCaps](#method.getBacklightCaps). When there is no "videoSourceInfo" field returned by [getBacklightCaps](#method.getBacklightCaps) then "Global" refers to all video sources returned by "videoSources" field of [getVideoSourceCaps](#method.getVideoSourceCaps).

videoFormat.summary:
The video format that the backlight level is reset for.

e.g. [ "Global" ] OR ["Current", "HDR10", "SDR", "DV"]

The caller can either pass "Current" or "Global" as single value in the array or can pass any number of customisable video formats that the backlight need to reset to default. When omitted "Global" is the default assumed.

Other valid values for a platform can be obtained from the [getBacklightCaps](#method.getBacklightCaps) "videoFormatInfo" property

"Current" specifies the current selected video format which can be obtained from [getVideoFormat](#method.getVideoFormat). When there is no active video playback or input port selected, usage of "Current" will refer to "SDR" video format as default. If "Current" video format is not part of "videoFormatInfo" field returned by [getBacklightCaps](#method.getBacklightCaps), then it is not customizable and cannot be used.

"Global" specifies that backlight is reset for all customisable video formats that are returned in "videoFormatInfo" field by [getBacklightCaps](#method.getBacklightCaps). When there is no "videoFormatInfo" field returned by [getBacklightCaps](#method.getBacklightCaps) then "Global" refers to all video sources returned by "videoFormats" field of [getVideoFormatCaps](#method.getVideoFormatCaps).

resetBrightness.summary:
Resets the TV brightness to factory default for a given picture mode, video format and video source.

The reset value will be persisted across reboots.

This method is only available in the RDK TV device profile.

pictureMode.summary:
The picture mode that the brightness level is reset for.

e.g. [ "Global" ] OR ["Current", "Standard", "Sports", "EnergySaving" ]

The caller can either pass "Current" or "Global" as single value in the array or can pass any number of customisable picture modes that the brightness need to reset to default. When omitted "Global" is the default assumed.

Other valid values for a platform can be obtained from the [getBrightnessCaps](#method.getBrightnessCaps) "pictureModeInfo" property

"Current" specifies the current selected picture mode which can be obtained from [getPictureMode](#method.getPictureMode). If current selected picture mode is not part of pictureModeInfo field returned by [getBrightnessCaps](#method.getBrightnessCaps), then it is not customizable and cannot be used.

"Global" specifies that brightness is reset for all customisable pictures modes that are returned in pictureModeInfo field by [getBrightnessCaps](#method.getBrightnessCaps). When there is no pictureModeInfo field returned by [getBrightnessCaps](#method.getBrightnessCaps) then "Global" refers to all picture modes returned by "pictureModes" field of [getPictureModeCaps](#method.getPictureModeCaps).

videoSource.summary:
The video source that the brightness level is reset for.

e.g. [ "Global" ] OR [ "Current", "HDMI1", "Composite1", "IP"]

The caller can either pass "Current" or "Global" as single value in the array or can pass any number of customisable video sources that the brightness need to reset to default. When omitted "Global" is the default assumed.

Other valid values for a platform can be obtained from the [getBrightnessCaps](#method.getBrightnessCaps) "videoSourceInfo" property

"Current" specifies the current selected video source which can be obtained from [getVideoSource](#method.getVideoSource). When there is no active video playback or input port selected, usage of "Current" will refer to "IP" video source as default. If "Current" video source is not part of "videoSourceInfo" field returned by [getBrightnessCaps](#method.getBrightnessCaps), then it is not customizable and cannot be used.

"Global" specifies that brightness is reset for all customisable video sources that are returned in "videoSourceInfo" field by [getBrightnessCaps](#method.getBrightnessCaps). When there is no "videoSourceInfo" field returned by [getBrightnessCaps](#method.getBrightnessCaps) then "Global" refers to all video sources returned by "videoSources" field of [getVideoSourceCaps](#method.getVideoSourceCaps).

videoFormat.summary:
The video format that the brightness level is reset for.

e.g. [ "Global" ] OR ["Current", "HDR10", "SDR", "DV"]

The caller can either pass "Current" or "Global" as single value in the array or can pass any number of customisable video formats that the brightness need to reset to default. When omitted "Global" is the default assumed.

Other valid values for a platform can be obtained from the [getBrightnessCaps](#method.getBrightnessCaps) "videoFormatInfo" property

"Current" specifies the current selected video format which can be obtained from [getVideoFormat](#method.getVideoFormat). When there is no active video playback or input port selected, usage of "Current" will refer to "SDR" video format as default. If "Current" video format is not part of "videoFormatInfo" field returned by [getBrightnessCaps](#method.getBrightnessCaps), then it is not customizable and cannot be used.

"Global" specifies that brightness is reset for all customisable video formats that are returned in "videoFormatInfo" field by getBrightnessCaps. When there is no "videoFormatInfo" field returned by [getBrightnessCaps](#method.getBrightnessCaps) then "Global" refers to all video sources returned by "videoFormats" field of [getVideoFormatCaps](#method.getVideoFormatCaps).

"Global" specifies that CMS is reset for all customizable colors that are returned in "colorInfo" field from [getCMSCaps](#method.getCMSCaps).

Other valid values for a platform can be obtained from the [getCMSCaps](#method.getCMSCaps) "componentInfo" property

"Global" specifies that CMS is reset for all customizable components that are returned in "componentInfo" field from [getCMSCaps](#method.getCMSCaps).

When there is no active video playback or input port selected, usage of "Current" will refer to "IP" video source as default. If "Current" video source is not part of "videoSourceInfo" field returned by [getLowLatencyStateCaps](#method.getLowLatencyStateCaps), then it is not customizable and cannot be used.

"Global" specifies that low latency state is reset for all customisable video sources that are returned in "videoSourceInfo" field by [getLowLatencyStateCaps](#method.getLowLatencyStateCaps). When there is no "videoSourceInfo" field returned by [getLowLatencyStateCaps](#method.getLowLatencyStateCaps) then "Global" refers to all video sources returned by "videoSources" field of [getVideoSourceCaps](#method.getVideoSourceCaps).

videoFormat.summary:
The video format that the low latency state is reset for.

e.g. [ "Global" ] OR ["Current", "HDR10", "SDR", "DV"]

The caller can either pass "Current" or "Global" as single value in the array or can pass any number of customisable video formats that the low latency state need to reset to default. When omitted "Global" is the default assumed.

Other valid values for a platform can be obtained from the [getLowLatencyStateCaps](#method.getLowLatencyStateCaps) "videoFormatInfo" property

"Current" specifies the current selected video format which can be obtained from [getVideoFormat](#method.getVideoFormat). If "Current" video format is not part of "videoFormatInfo" field returned by [getLowLatencyStateCaps](#method.getLowLatencyStateCaps), then it is not customizable and cannot be used.

"Global" specifies that low latency state is reset for all customisable video formats that are returned in "videoFormatInfo" field by [getLowLatencyStateCaps](#method.getLowLatencyStateCaps). When there is no "videoFormatInfo" field returned by [getLowLatencyStateCaps](#method.getLowLatencyStateCaps) then "Global" refers to all video sources returned by "videoFormats" field of [getVideoFormatCaps](#method.getVideoFormatCaps).

Resets the HDR mode to factory default for a given picture mode, video source and video format.

The reset value will be persisted across reboots.

This method is only available in the RDK TV device profile.

pictureMode.summary:
The picture mode that the HDR mode is reset for.

e.g. [ "Global" ] OR ["Current", "Standard", "Sports", "EnergySaving" ]

The caller can either pass "Current" or "Global" as single value in the array or can pass any number of customisable picture modes that the HDR mode need to reset to default. When omitted "Global" is the default assumed.

Other valid values for a platform can be obtained from the [getHDRModeCaps](#method.getHDRModeCaps) "pictureModeInfo" property

"Current" specifies the current selected picture mode which can be obtained from [getPictureMode](#method.getPictureMode). If current selected picture mode is not part of pictureModeInfo field returned by [getHDRModeCaps](#method.getHDRModeCaps), then it is not customizable and cannot be used.

"Global" specifies that HDR mode is reset for all customisable pictures modes that are returned in pictureModeInfo field by [getHDRModeCaps](#method.getHDRModeCaps). When there is no pictureModeInfo field returned by [getHDRModeCaps](#method.getHDRModeCaps) then "Global" refers to all picture modes returned by "pictureModes" field of [getPictureModeCaps](#method.getPictureModeCaps).

videoSource.summary:
The video source that the HDR mode is reset for.

e.g. [ "Global" ] OR [ "Current", "HDMI1", "IP"]

The caller can either pass "Current" or "Global" as single value in the array or can pass any number of customisable video sources that the HDR mode need to reset to default. When omitted "Global" is the default assumed.

Other valid values for a platform can be obtained from the [getHDRModeCaps](#method.getHDRModeCaps) "videoSourceInfo" property

"Current" specifies the current selected video source which can be obtained from [getVideoSource](#method.getVideoSource). When there is no active video playback or input port selected, usage of "Current" will refer to "IP" video source as default. If "Current" video source is not part of "videoSourceInfo" field returned by [getHDRModeCaps](#method.getHDRModeCaps), then it is not customizable and cannot be used.

"Global" specifies that HDR mode is reset for all customisable video sources that are returned in "videoSourceInfo" field by [getHDRModeCaps](#method.getHDRModeCaps). When there is no "videoSourceInfo" field returned by [getHDRModeCaps](#method.getHDRModeCaps) then "Global" refers to all video sources returned by "videoSources" field of [getVideoSourceCaps](#method.getVideoSourceCaps) except Tuner and Composite1.

videoFormat.summary:
The video format that the HDR mode is reset for.

e.g. [ "Global" ] OR ["Current", "HDR10", "DV", "HLG"]

The caller can either pass "Current" or "Global" as single value in the array or can pass any number of customisable video formats that the HDR mode need to reset to default. When omitted "Global" is the default assumed.

Other valid values for a platform can be obtained from the [getHDRModeCaps](#method.getHDRModeCaps) "videoFormatInfo" property

"Current" specifies the current selected video format which can be obtained from [getVideoFormat](#method.getVideoFormat). When there is no active video playback or input port selected, usage of "Current" will refer to "SDR" video format as default and [setHDRMode()](#method.setHDRMode) will fail. If "Current" video format is not part of "videoFormatInfo" field returned by [getHDRModeCaps](#method.getHDRModeCaps), then it is not customizable and cannot be used.

"Global" specifies that HDR mode is reset for all customisable video formats that are returned in "videoFormatInfo" field by [getHDRModeCaps](#method.getHDRModeCaps). When there is no "videoFormatInfo" field returned by [getHDRModeCaps](#method.getHDRModeCaps) then "Global" refers to all video sources returned by "videoFormats" field of [getVideoFormatCaps](#method.getVideoFormatCaps) except SDR.
