setWBMode.summary:
This function will reconfigure the PQ pipeline for white balance calibration by disabling Local Dimming, Local Contrast, and Dynamic Contrast.

setWBMode(true) must be called by the app before [set2PointWB](#method.set2PointWB).

setWBMode(false) must be called by the app after [set2PointWB](#method.set2PointWB).

setWBMode() values are not persisted.

Note: When enabled all set/reset calls will return failure except the white balance methods.

This method is only available in the RDK TV device profile

wbMode.summary:
true: Enable white balance calibration mode.
false: Disable white balance calibration mode.

getWBMode.summary:
Get the white balance mode.

This method is only available in the RDK TV device profile

wbMode.summary:
true : If white balance mode calibration mode is enabled.
false : If white balance mode calibration mode is disabled.

get2PointWB.summary:
Gets the TV 2 point white balance control value for a given picture mode, video format, video source and color temperature.

This method is only available in the RDK TV device profile.

pictureMode.summary:
The picture mode that the white balance should be fetched for.

e.g. "Current", "Standard", "Sports", "EnergySaving".

"Current" - the current selected picture mode.

Other valid values for a platform can be obtained from options field of [getPictureModeCaps](#method.getPictureModeCaps).

The caller can pass a single valid value for this parameter. If omitted the default value assumed is "Current".

videoSource.summary:
The video source that the white balance should be fetched for.

e.g. "Current", "Composite1", "HDMI1", "HDMI2", "HDMI3", "IP", "Tuner".

"Current" - the current primary active source. When there is no active video playback or input port selected, "Current" refers to "IP" video source as default.

Other valid values for a platform can be obtained from options field of [getVideoSourceCaps](#method.getVideoSourceCaps).

The caller can pass a single valid value for this parameter. If omitted the default value assumed is "Current".

videoFormat.summary:
The video format that the white balance should be fetched for.

e.g. "Current", "SDR", "HDR10", "HLG", "DV".

"Current" - the current format of the current primary active source. When there is no active video playback or input port selected, "Current" refers to "SDR" video format as default.

Other valid values for a platform can be obtained from options field of [getVideoFormatCaps](#method.getVideoFormatCaps).

The caller can pass a single valid value for this parameter. If omitted the default value assumed is "Current".

colorTemperature.summary:
The colorTemperature that the white balance values should be fetched for.

e.g. "Standard" , "Warm" , "Cold" , "UserDefined".

Other valid values for a platform can be obtained from colorTemperatureInfo field of [get2PointWBCaps](#method.get2PointWBCaps).

The caller can pass a single valid value for this parameter.

color.summary:
The color that the white balance values should be fetched for.

e.g. "Red" , "Green" , "Blue".

Other valid values for a platform can be obtained from colorInfo field of [get2PointWBCaps](#method.get2PointWBCaps).

The caller can pass a single valid value for this parameter.

control.summary:
The control value that the white balance should be fetched for.

e.g. "Gain" , "Offset".

Other valid values for a platform can be obtained from controlInfo field of [get2PointWBCaps](#method.get2PointWBCaps).

The caller can pass a single valid value for this parameter.

level.summary: The whiteBalance in the range from - to inclusive.

get2PointWBCaps.summary:
Gets the capabilities and boundary range for TV 2 point white balance. It returns the range of TV 2pt white balance value that the user can set and the list of possible picture modes, video sources, video formats, color Temperature, control and color that the white balance may be customized for.

This method is only available in the RDK TV device profile.

platformSupport.summary:
true: The platform supports white balance adjustment.
false: The platform does not supports white balance adjustment.

gainInfo.summary: Range of values for the white balance Gain

from.summary: The lower-inclusive range value for white balance Gain.

to.summary: The higher-inclusive range value for white balance Gain

offsetInfo.summary: Range of value for white balance offset

from.summary: The lower-inclusive range value for white balance offset.

to.summary: The lower-inclusive range value for white balance offset.

pictureModeInfo.summary:
Array of picture modes that the white balance could be customized for. These are few examples of picture modes available in this array: ["Standard", "Vivid","Custom", "Movie", "Sports"].This API will return the entire list of picture modes returned by [getPictureModeCaps](#method.getPictureModeCaps) or a subset of it.

If color temperature cannot be customized for picture modes, then this property is not returned.

videoSourceInfo.summary:
Array of video sources that the white balance could be customized for. These are few examples of video sources available in this array: ["Composite1", "HDMI1", "HDMI2", "HDMI3", "IP" ]. This API will return the entire list of video sources returned by [getVideoSourceCaps](#method.getVideoSourceCaps), or a subset of it.

If WhiteBalance cannot be customized for video sources, then this property is not returned.

videoFormatInfo.summary:
Array of video formats that the white balance could be customized for. These are few examples of formats available in this array: ["SDR","HLG","HDR10","DV"]. This API will return the entire list of video formats returned by [getVideoFormatCaps](#method.getVideoFormatCaps), or a subset of it.

If white balance cannot be customized for video format, then this property is not returned.

colorInfo.summary: Array of color values that the white balance could be customized for. These are few examples of formats available in this array: ["Red", "Green", "Blue"].

controlInfo.summary: Array of control values that the white balance could be customized for. These are few examples of formats available in this array: ["Gain", "Offset"].

colorTemperatureInfo.summary: Array of colorTemperature values that the white balance could be customized for. These are few examples of formats available in this array: ["Standard","Warm","Cold","UserDefined"].

set2PointWB.summary:
Sets the TV 2 point white balance for a specified videoSource, colorTemperature, color and control value. The white balance value that is to be set should be within the range which is returned by the API [get2PointWBCaps](#method.get2PointWBCaps).

This method is only available in the RDK TV device profile

pictureMode.summary:
The picture mode that the white balance is customized for.

e.g. [ "Global" ] OR ["Current", "Standard", "Sports", "EnergySaving" ]

The caller can either pass "Current" or "Global" as single value in the array or can pass any number of customisable picture modes. When omitted "Global" is the default assumed.

Other valid values for a platform can be obtained from the [get2PointWBCaps](#method.get2PointWBCaps) "pictureModeInfo" property

"Current" specifies the current selected picture mode which can be obtained from [getPictureMode](#method.getPictureMode). If current selected picture mode is not part of pictureModeInfo field returned by [get2PointWBCaps](#method.get2PointWBCaps), then it is not customizable and cannot be used.

"Global" specifies that white balance is changed for all customisable pictures modes that are returned in pictureModeInfo field by [get2PointWBCaps](#method.get2PointWBCaps). When there is no pictureModeInfo field returned by [get2PointWBCaps](#method.get2PointWBCaps) then "Global" refers to all picture modes returned by "pictureModes" field of [getPictureModeCaps](#method.getPictureModeCaps).

videoSource.summary:
The video source that the white balance level is customised for.

e.g. [ "Global" ] OR [ "Current", "HDMI1", "Composite1", "IP"]

The caller can either pass "Current" or "Global" as single value in the array or can pass any number of customisable video sources. When omitted "Global" is the default assumed.

Other valid values for a platform can be obtained from the [get2PointWBCaps](#method.get2PointWBCaps) "videoSourceInfo" property

"Current" specifies the current selected video source which can be obtained from [getVideoSource](#method.getVideoSource). When there is no active video playback or input port selected, usage of "Current" will refer to "IP" video source as default. If current selected video source is not part of videoSourceInfo field returned by [get2PointWBCaps](#method.get2PointWBCaps), then it is not customizable and cannot be used.

"Global" specifies that white balance is changed for all customisable video sources that are returned in videoSourceInfo field by [get2PointWBCaps](#method.get2PointWBCaps). When there is no videoSourceInfo field returned by [get2PointWBCaps](#method.get2PointWBCaps) then "Global" refers to all video sources returned by "videoSources" field of [getVideoSourceCaps](#method.getVideoSourceCaps).

videoFormat.summary:
The video format that the white balance level is customised for.

e.g. [ "Global" ] OR ["Current", "HDR10", "SDR", "DV"]

The caller can either pass "Current" or "Global" as single value in the array or can pass any number of customisable video formats. When omitted "Global" is the default assumed.

Other valid values for a platform can be obtained from the [get2PointWBCaps](#method.get2PointWBCaps) "videoFormatInfo" property

"Current" specifies the current selected video format which can be obtained from [getVideoFormat](#method.getVideoFormat). When there is no active video playback or input port selected, usage of "Current" will refer to "SDR" video format as default. If current selected video format is not part of videoSourceInfo field returned by [get2PointWBCaps](#method.get2PointWBCaps), then it is not customizable and cannot be used.

"Global" specifies that white balance is changed for all customisable video formats that are returned in videoFormatInfo field by [get2PointWBCaps](#method.get2PointWBCaps). When there is no videoFormatInfo field returned by [get2PointWBCaps](#method.get2PointWBCaps) then "Global" refers to all video formats returned by "videoFormats" field of [getVideoFormatCaps](#method.getVideoFormatCaps).

color.summary: The color value for WhiteBalance customization. It should be within the range as retrieved from colorInfo of [get2PointWBCaps](#method.get2PointWBCaps)

control.summary: The control value for WhiteBalance customization. It should be within the range as retrieved from controlInfo of [get2PointWBCaps](#method.get2PointWBCaps)

colorTemperature.summary: The colorTemperature value for WhiteBalance customization. It should be within the range as retrieved from colorTemperatureInfo of [get2PointWBCaps](#method.get2PointWBCaps)

level.summary: The WB to be set. It should be within the range as retrieved from [get2PointWBCaps](#method.get2PointWBCaps)

reset2PointWB.summary:
Resets the TV 2 point white balance to factory default for a given picture mode, video format and video source.

The reset value will be persisted across reboots.

This method is only available in the RDK TV device profile.

pictureMode.summary:
The picture mode that the white balance is reset for.

e.g. [ "Global" ] OR ["Current", "Standard", "Sports", "EnergySaving" ]

The caller can either pass "Current" or "Global" as single value in the array or can pass any number of customisable picture modes that the white balance need to reset to default. When omitted "Global" is the default assumed.

Other valid values for a platform can be obtained from the [get2PointWBCaps](#method.get2PointWBCaps) "pictureModeInfo" property

"Current" specifies the current selected picture mode which can be obtained from [getPictureMode](#method.getPictureMode). If current selected picture mode is not part of pictureModeInfo field returned by [get2PointWBCaps](#method.get2PointWBCaps), then it is not customizable and cannot be used.

"Global" specifies that white balance is reset for all customisable pictures modes that are returned in pictureModeInfo field by [get2PointWBCaps](#method.get2PointWBCaps). When there is no pictureModeInfo field returned by [get2PointWBCaps](#method.get2PointWBCaps) then "Global" refers to all picture modes returned by "pictureModes" field of [getPictureModeCaps](#method.getPictureModeCaps).

videoSource.summary:
The video source that the white balance is reset for.

e.g. [ "Global" ] OR [ "Current", "HDMI1", "Composite1", "IP"]

The caller can either pass "Current" or "Global" as single value in the array or can pass any number of customisable video sources that the white balance need to reset to default. When omitted "Global" is the default assumed.

Other valid values for a platform can be obtained from the [get2PointWBCaps](#method.get2PointWBCaps) "videoSourceInfo" property

"Current" specifies the current selected video source which can be obtained from [getVideoSource](#method.getVideoSource). When there is no active video playback or input port selected, usage of "Current" will refer to "IP" video source as default. If "Current" video source is not part of "videoSourceInfo" field returned by [get2PointWBCaps](#method.get2PointWBCaps), then it is not customizable and cannot be used.

"Global" specifies that white balance is reset for all customisable video sources that are returned in "videoSourceInfo" field by [get2PointWBCaps](#method.get2PointWBCaps). When there is no "videoSourceInfo" field returned by [get2PointWBCaps](#method.get2PointWBCaps) then "Global" refers to all video sources returned by "videoSources" field of [getVideoSourceCaps](#method.getVideoSourceCaps).

videoFormat.summary:
The video format that the white balance is reset for.

e.g. [ "Global" ] OR ["Current", "HDR10", "SDR", "DV"]

The caller can either pass "Current" or "Global" as single value in the array or can pass any number of customisable video formats that the white balance need to reset to default. When omitted "Global" is the default assumed.

Other valid values for a platform can be obtained from the [get2PointWBCaps](#method.get2PointWBCaps) "videoFormatInfo" property

"Current" specifies the current selected video format which can be obtained from [getVideoFormat](#method.getVideoFormat). When there is no active video playback or input port selected, usage of "Current" will refer to "SDR" video format as default. If "Current" video format is not part of "videoFormatInfo" field returned by [get2PointWBCaps](#method.get2PointWBCaps), then it is not customizable and cannot be used.

"Global" specifies that white balance is reset for all customisable video formats that are returned in "videoFormatInfo" field by [get2PointWBCaps](#method.get2PointWBCaps). When there is no "videoFormatInfo" field returned by [get2PointWBCaps](#method.get2PointWBCaps) then "Global" refers to all video sources returned by "videoFormats" field of [getVideoFormatCaps](#method.getVideoFormatCaps).

onVideoSourceChanged.summary: Event notification when there is a change in video source of the video being played

currentVideoSource.summary:
Video source of the video currently being played.

e.g. "HDMI1", "HDMI2", "HDMI4", "IP", "Tuner", "Composite1", "None"

None - Returned when no active video is played.

For full list of supported video formats refer [getVideoSourceCaps](#method.getVideoSourceCaps)

onVideoFormatChanged.summary: Event notification when there is a change in video format of the video being played.

currentVideoFormat.summary:
Video format of the video currently being played.

e.g. "SDR","HLG","HDR10","DV","None"

None - Returned when no active video is played.

For full list of supported video formats refer [getVideoFormatCaps](#method.getVideoFormatCaps)

onVideoResolutionChanged.summary:
Event notification when there is a change in video resolution of the current video played out on HDMI and Composite1 video sources when they are selected.

This method is only available in the RDK TV device profile.

NOTE: At present this event is supported only for HDMI and Composite1 video sources only.

currentVideoResolution.summary:
Video resolution of the video currently being played.

e.g.
"None","720\*240p","720\*288p","720\*480i","720\*480p","960\*540p","720\*576i","720\*576p","800\*600p","1280\*720p","1280\*768p","1280\*960p","1280\*1024p","1920\*1080i","2560\*1080p","1920\*1200p","2560\*1440p","4096\*2160p"

None - Returned when no active video is played.

For full list of supported video formats refer [getVideoResolutionCaps](#method.getVideoResolutionCaps)

onVideoFrameRateChanged.summary:
Event notification when there is a change in video frame rate of the video being played.

This method is only available in the RDK TV device profile.

NOTE: At present this event is supported only for HDMI and Composite1 video sources only.

currentVideoFrameRate.summary:
Video frame rate of the video currently being played.

e.g. 24,25,30,50,60,23.98,29.97,59.94, None

None - Returned when no active video is played.

For full list of supported video frame rates refer [getVideoFrameRateCaps](#method.getVideoFrameRateCaps)

onVideoContentChanged.summary:
Event notification when there is any form of video content changes were detected. An example of such a change is detection of FilmMaker mode.

This method is only available in the RDK TV device profile.

filmMakerMode.summary:
Possible values are true and false

true - Film Maker mode active
false -Film Maker mode not active

filmMakerModeSources.summary:
A list of sources in which the Film Maker mode event occurred.

If there "params.filmMakerMode" is false this parmaeter is not passed.

Possible video sources for film maker mode are HDMI sources (as returned by [getVideoSourceCaps](#method.getVideoSourceCaps)) and IP source
